intro: Didymopanax piauhyensis, commonly known as the Piauhy palm, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in compound inflorescences, followed by dark red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest for both ecological and horticultural studies.
